lexUnit.name: hurt.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause physical pain or injury to.

sentence.text: The man picked me up , roughly , and hurt me .
The idea of another man having sexual intercourse with his sister drove him wild , as did the idea of someone hurting her .
The young woman cried : ` Has he hurt you ?
Experience told him that a woman 's natural instinct was to defend herself rather than to hurt the attacker .
It was a student , they said , very badly hurt , possibly dead .
And here came a vision of Simon , terribly hurt by Gazzer 's knife and left to bleed to death in some stinking alley .
Dot did n't want to hurt its face so she placed her knees carefully to one side of the lamb so that they pressed into the sewn field of flowers on the edge .
SIXTEEN police officers were hurt , including seven sprayed with CS gas , and 51 people were arrested at an acid house party , police said yesterday .
Clive liked to hurt people as much as the next person , felt the need to confirm his power over others , but Mr Skinner was a specialist , an expert .
Sheriff Higgins said yesterday when Arthur appeared for sentence that witnesses said the accused had threatened earlier that he was going to hurt his victim .
` I hurt him so bad he 's gone to hospital . "
This family knows one way of persuasion : they hurt you bad .
` Last night you were threatening to ruin him if he hurt Maria Luisa again ; now you 're condoning their going away together . "
I wo n't hurt you , but if you come near the boat , I 'll shoot you through the head ! "
Well , someone should hurt them back .
A BRITISH Telecom worker has been murdered and another badly hurt by bandits in Nigeria .
